data.title: Good breakfast
data.text: quaint little place just off the square in downtown Springfield, MO.  A decent breakfast when I was a meat eater. I haven't been there since I have gone meat and dairy free; that has been 6 years ago.

data.title: Fun to dance and eat
data.text: This bar is a golden gym located on the south east corner of the square with great food and drinks.  My friends always prefer this patio when big events are going on in the square

data.title: Good food and good service
data.text: We had never been there before and had read some good and some not so good reviews, so we didn't really know what to expect.  We were greeted as we entered, our server was pleasant and prompt.  Our glasses were never more than half empty before she offered to refill them.  We had a salad, which was very fresh, and a hamburger with onion rings.  Both were excellent.  We were very pleased with the quality of the food and the service.  Also, they had music playing in the background at the perfect level, and several TV's with sports channels.

data.title: Very nice employees, but the food is lacking
data.text:
We bought a restaurants.com gift certificate and decided to give this place a try, since we are always looking for a new restaurant.  
Pros:  The cleanliness of the bar was ok. The waitress was nice as well as the gentleman behind the bar.  The onion rings were hot and good. 

Cons:  My veggie burger wasn't hot, it was  warm.  The tenderloin sandwich was more breading than meat.  The prices on the menu were not the prices on our bill.  My burger was .50 higher than on the menu.  The waitress told us that the sides came with the meal, but I was charged for both the sides, she was new, so I didn't even say anything.  That one is on me.  The restaurant is only open on Friday and Saturday, so keep that in mind.

data.title: Unprofessional Staff, Lousy Service, Poor Food
data.text:
Took the family there and ordered 3 burgers and fries all medium rare, The waitress was okay to start with, until the food came. She brought a wrong burger, which wasn't replaced until my son finished his and didn't care that all three were cooked well done, not mid-rare as ordered. She then preceded to ignore us and spent the next little while with her fingerrs in her mouth, (very sanitary). We had to go to the bar to ask for our check at which point she was rude and belligerent expecting huge kudos for not charging me for the overcooked burger we didn't eat. The bar manager dismissed us and crumpled our check up because he didn't want to stop flirting with the only other waitress there. 
1. Wait staff has poor sanitation.
2. The food is too close to Burger King to call itself a good Bar and Grill
3. The cook/Bar Manager can't cook anything unless its well done,
4. They simply don't care- at all.
5. The one decent thing: the fries are okay .

If you want a killer burger that is worth your time and money, my favorite place is just a block or two away at Riad's. Huge difference, 

Shame on the Blue Bull Bar and Grill for unprofessional conduct, poor quality food, and trashy service.

data.title: So Blue
data.text:
We went here on a Saturday afternoon. The waitress was very pleasant and accomodating.I had a burger which was very good.My friend had the pork tenderloin and was not impressed with it at all. The bun was cold like it had just come out of the cooler.The onion rings were overcooked.
I am so blue we wont go back there.

data.title: Fun
data.text: We go here a few times a year when we are in town and absolutely love it. It's a casual environment with fabulous food and drinks. Great staff as well!

data.title: Excellent
data.text: We ate lunch at this restaurant on the square in downtown Springfield.  I had the "Homemade Hand Breaded Tenderloin" - it was absolutely delicious - one of the best I have ever had.  It came with fries which were also good.  My husband had the chicken quesadilla which he thought was also very good.  The servings were large - we ended up sharing the tenderloin and fries and taking most of the quesadilla home.  Good, friendly service too. It was very quiet at lunch time.  I'll definitely be going back here.
